p: The genus Alphavirus encompasses pathogens that are transmitted by arthropods, essentially by mosquitoes of the genera Culex and Aedes, and can cause various diseases in humans and animals. In addition to the neurotropic alphaviruses that can cause encephalitis, in particular the different types of equine encephalitis viruses and some other alphaviruses of the New World, alphaviruses play a role in Europe, Africa and Asia, and usually provoke mild symptoms or moderate arthritis.
